technical-data.invention-title: VERFAHREN UND SYSTEM ZUR WIEDERVERWERTUNG VON KOMMUNALEN FESTABFÄLLEN UND NUTZUNG DES FESTABFALLRÜCKGEWINNUNGSBRENNSTOFFES
METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR THE RECYCLING OF MUNICIPAL SOLID WASTES, AND EXPLOITATION OF THE WASTED SOLID RECOVERY FUEL
PROCEDE ET SYSTEME DE RECYCLAGE DE RESIDUS URBAINS SOLIDES, ET EXPLOITATION DU COMBUSTIBLE DE RECUPERATION SOLIDE USE

addressbook.last-name: SORAIN CECCHINI AMBIENTE SCA S P A

description.p: The present invention relates to a method and a system for the complete recycling of municipal solid wastes with minimal environmental impact and with the use of the wasted solid recovery fuel (WSRF) for the production of electric energy and/or hydrogen.

The term waste is intended to mean all products that are no longer of use and which are to be disposed and any substance derived from human activities or natural cycles that is abandoned or destined to be abandoned. Municipal solid waste treatment and recycling systems have been studied for a long time, due to the always growing necessity of an effective, environment-friendly disposal and of a functional use of the waste as an energy source.

According to those necessities, a first object of the present invention is to find a method which allows the maximum recovery of the waste products with consequent energy recovery with a minimal environmental impact; a further object of the present invention is to provide a suitable system for the achievement of a cost-effective and energy-exploiting recycling process.
The document FR-A-2780 320 discloses a method in accordance with the preamble of claim 1 and a system in accordance with the preamble of claim 10.
According to the present invention the above mentioned objects are obtained by a method according to claim 1 and a system according to claim 10.
Further advantages are disclosed in the dependent claims.

It must be pointed out that all operations connected with the various procedures are undertaken inside industrial plants provided with suitable flooring, that is closed and shows a forced ventilation system that is in continuous operation and which keeps the entire interior environment in a condition of slight reduction in pressure. This ventilation system focuses on a centralized purification system, which ensures the abatement of dust and odour.
description.heading: ■ Receiving the municipal solid waste.
description.p: The self-compacting devices, which supply the waste to the system after the weighing process, are sent to the incoming section for unloading.

Access to this section by the self-compactors occurs by means of large doors complete with automatic shutters, which remain open only for the time necessary for vehicle transit. After the waste is unloaded, it is conveyed to the mechanical sorting line, onto which the waste is loaded using electro-hydraulic cranes with crab bucket, which serves to supply the production lines, and also undertakes to remove any bulky materials which are crushed and reduced in size on the special operating line.
description.heading: ■ Mechanical sorting of the dry and wet fractions
description.p: The system is provided with one or more sorting lines having capacity of up to 100 t/h each. The waste, loaded onto the line, undergoes the first treatment stage that consists in the splitting of the packaging in which the waste was originally collected, followed by a size-sorting stage. A low-speed tearing device acts to split the packing and the sacks, to free the contents without having any excessive abrasive or crushing action, which would serve to annul the various features that characterize the various types of products, thereby reducing the mechanical sorting process efficiency.
The subsequent mechanical sorting of the dry and wet fractions occurs through the screening grates of rotating trommels with self-cleaning device.

This rotating separator is equipped with meshes of adequate size to separate the following materials:
dry component consisting of materials with a high calorific value (paper, plastics, cloths, rubber etc)
wet component mainly consisting of coarse organic substances (usually still mixed with glass, stones etc).
description.heading: ■ Dry fraction treatment and preparation of the WSRF
description.p: The treatment of the dry fraction, firstly undergoes the removal of the metallic components, in which every kind of metallic element is removed, before undergoing a special sizing process, by means of a special shredder equipped with a particular kind of extendable grating, connected to a wind shifting system with subsequent cleaning and quality enhancement system. The combined action of these devices results in the production of Wasted Solid recovered Fuel. The WSRF is then conveyed to two stationary compactors for direct loading, in fluff form, to tractors and semi-trailers for transportation to the thermo-exploitation plant. In parallel, there is also a packaging line which forms the material into bales and shrink-warps them with stretch film for the eventual provisional storage of the WSRF during the planned maintenance intervals of thermo-exploitation system.
description.heading: ■ Metal recovery
description.p: The iron and aluminium are respectively separated by electro-magnetic action, i.e. under the action of the inducted current flows. The ferrous materials are purified in a special line and converted into "PROLER". The aluminium is packed into bales. Subsequently both recycled products are sent to the respective production industries to be reused.
description.heading: ■ Aerobic treatment of the wet fraction
description.p: The operation consists in a bio-oxidation reaction based on a process which takes places in aerobic digesters on maturation basins, consisting of rectangular tanks, parallel or series mounted, with a standard width of 22 metres and of variable length of up to over 150 metres, as a function to the daily output. In both those digesters with parallel positioned tanks and those with tanks positioned in series, the process is of sufficient duration to ensure the maturation and the total biological stabilization of the organic substances. During this stage, the biomass is subject to an intense accelerated reaction, during which intense biological activity takes place that promotes the rapid decomposition of the biodegradable substances. The tanks are installed in completely segregated areas of the system. The Bio-oxidation reaction of the biomasses inside the tanks on a layer approx. 3 metre thick, is controlled and maintained fully aerobic by means of the forced ventilation and timed mechanical overturning. The ventilation system comprises a capillary distribution network so as to ensure process uniformity and avoiding the possible formation of any aerobic sacks.

The overturning operation, carried out by special bridges equipped with screw augers, ensures the maintenance of the material porosity, avoiding the formation of any preferential channels, which would otherwise result in process anomalies.

The aerobic treatment comprises, in synthesis, the following stages and procedural-times:
accelerated decomposition of the organic substances for 2-3 weeks,
separation of the inert processing residues from the bio-mass and
maturation and stabilization of the organic fraction for 5-6 weeks.
All operations, including material loading and unloading, are automatically carried out and do not require any intervention from the personnel.
description.heading: ■ Refining of the stabilized bio-waste (or organic fraction).
description.p: At the end of the aerobic treatment processes, the digested and stabilized organic component is conveyed to the final mechanical refining line in order to purify it of all inert fragments such as glass, stones, plastics, etc.
This line also undertakes further recovery of WSRF from the processing residues.

This operation is also automatic and, at the end of the operation, the processing residues, the WSRF and the stabilized biowaste (grey compost) are obtained with a dynamic respiration index (DRI) suitable for use in operations of ecological restoration.
description.heading: ■ Volume reduction of bulky materials
description.p: The treatment of the bulky materials consists in a very forced grinding operation that, by means of material crushing, succeeds in effectively reducing the volume whilst assuring the recovery of any ferrous materials.
The crushed material is loaded into special containers for final destination which may be a thermo-exploitation plant, in the event of suitably combustible materials, or to a plant servicing dump.
description.heading: ■ Process air treatment
description.p: This process foresees that every working stage is maintained in slight negative pressure conditions by sucking air; said sucked air is then sent to the combustion cycles of the WSRF. The sucked air passes through a bio-filter that guarantees the best possible results in terms of yield and odour abatement. This filter consists of a bed of suitably treated biomasses, with a high degree of porosity and extended biologically active surfaces that ensures the best possible results in terms of yield and odour abatement. The forced air intake of the abatement system is through a series of centrifugal fans. The use of closed conveyor belts and dust exhaust hoods on the machines helps to reduce the amount of dust released into the working environment and consequently the amounts of air to be treated. The organic material aerobic treatment basins, where odour emission is greater, are enclosed in completely segregated areas, constantly kept under vacuum (day and night) to prevent any air escape.

The innovative aspect of the process consists in the gasification of the WSRF, which is supplied with continuous and homogeneous flow, together with melting and vitrifying action on the ashes present in the same, classified as inert material, and the production of electric energy through a combined high-efficiency cycle system, using the synthesis gas derived from the gasification process.

The WSRF is subjected to high-temperature gasification and the energy necessary for the gasification reactions inside the reactor is produced by means of oxygen and fuel burners. If the gasification system is located in a waste dump area, the majority of WSRF sorting and production systems being in fact within the vicinity of the dump, the fuel used for the burners will be the biogas recovered from the anaerobic digestion process of the deposited biowaste of the dump itself.

The synthesis gases derived from gasification undergo a forced cleaning process so that they can be used in high efficiency combined energy cycles such as:
Endothermic engines with recovery boiler and steam cycle through a turbo-alternator
Gas turbines with steam cycle recovery boiler with thermo-alternator
Fuel cells
Turbogas thermal generating stations

This technique is very different from the traditional WSRF energy exploitation systems, as the recovery of the energy contained in the WSRF, in processes involving grid furnaces or boilers and/or fluid-bed furnaces or boilers, occurs through transformation of the direct thermal energy contained in the hot fumes generated by the combustion process into high-pressure steam, which is expanded in an electricity-producing turbine. Furthermore, the solids from traditional combustion processes, consisting of slag, ashes and filtration powders, are normally non-reclaimable products.

On the contrary, in the gasification process proposed here, the inorganic compounds present in the WSRF are converted, by means of a high-temperature melting process, into recyclable mineral substances (vitrified mineral granulate and metallic granulate), while the sulphur compounds (H2S, CS2, COS) present in the synthesis gas are eliminated, thereby recovering the sulphur. Finally the rapid cooling process (in only a few milliseconds) of the synthesis gas avoids the re-formation of any dioxin and furan compounds, what occurs in the traditional waste combustion processes as the result of the cooling of the fumes inside the boiler within a temperature delta of 250° and 300°.
A further object of the present invention is to provide a system for the achievement of the above-described method.
This object is obtained by the system in accordance with claim 10.

description.heading: ■ WSRF Supply system
description.p: As WSRF is a homogeneous fuel, both in terms of its sizing and chemical-physical features, the process does not require any pre-treatment, so that the fuel is supplied in the "fluff' form, without any additional extrusion and/or pellet preparation treatments, as is the case in other gasification treatments.

The means of conveyance of the WSRF into the gasification reactor 8 has a particularly innovative feature of making use of a technique to permit the continuous and homogeneous flow of the fuel into the reactor.

The continuous supply process allows, owing to a homogeneous fuel such as WSRF, to get stable gasification and a constant production rate of synthesis gas in ratio to the volume and calorific value of the gas itself.

The system for continuous feeding of WSRF into the reactor 8, shown in two different versions A, B in figure 1, consists of:
a WSRF storage silo
a conveyance system (1) of the WSRF from the storage silo to a dosing receiver (2)
conveyance system (3) of the WSRF from the dosing receiver (2) to an inlet system (5) into the gasification reactor (8)
a double sealing system (4) with valves
an inertisation system with Nitrogen,
a conveyance system (5) for feeding the WSRF into the gasification reactor (8)
an excessive capacity recovery system (6)

The WSRF is fed, as shown in figure 2, to the high-temperature reactor 8 by means of the feeder system 5 which can be a cooled screw feeder or a slope. The reducing environment inside the gasification reactor 8 is maintained at a high temperature thanks to thermal energy generated by the burners 11, powered by oxygen and biogas (or natural gas or LPG), thereby permitting gasification to take place. The volatile components in the WSRF are instantly gassed, while the less volatile carbonious part is deposited on the lower part 9 of the reactor 8 to be subsequently gassed. Thanks to a sufficiently long reaction time inside the reactor (< 2 seconds), the macro-molecular components present in the synthesis gas are converted, in the upper part of the reactor 10, into simple molecules (H2, CO, CH4, CO2, H20) thereby ensuring a thermo-dynamic equilibrium. Thanks to the large cross-section area of the reactor, the synthesis gases, generated by gasification, takes on an ascending speed, diminishing from the centre of the reactor towards the walls of the same, of between 2 and 4 m/s, thereby avoiding the mass conveyance of the carbon and melted mineral particulate matter towards the reactor outlet.

By means the over-stoichiometric controlled addition of oxygen both in the lower and upper zones of the high-temperature reactor, and thanks to the exothermic reactions thereby created, the gas outlet temperature reaches 1100°C. In order to avoid the melting of the ashes conveyed by the ascending flow of the synthesis gas that, because of its own condensation, would cause the clogging of the system section immediately before the quench 16, temperatures higher than 1200°C are avoided.

A series of burners installed at the reactor upper section 10, above the supply system, give the synthesis gas a slight turbulence, optimising the temperature homogenisation. Such homogenisation prevents the risk of formation of any colder ascending currents (< 800°C) which would cause the creation of long molecular chains such as those of tars.

In the lower part 9 of the reactor 8, where the average temperature is comprised between 1500 and 1700°C and more particularly is about 1600°C, the inorganic components of the WSRF, which are the metallic and mineral matters, melt. The molten mass is collected by gravity into the melting crucible 9. This is held at working temperature through the addition of biogas (or either Neutral Gas or LPG) and pure oxygen, and with adequate period of permanence, the blending of the molten masses is thereby obtained.

A series of burners positioned horizontally in the radial launder trough of the melting crucible 9, provide the thermal energy needed to maintain the inorganic material, such as the minerals and metals originally contained in the WSRF, in liquid state, thereby ensuring a constant level inside the melting crucible. Secondarily, the gas flow created by the above mentioned burners, generate a kind of kinetic impulse sufficient to prevent the risk of accidental conveyance of any unburnt WSRF inside the inlet trough direct to the launder trough of the crucible 9. The molten mass enters through a channel 12 the granulate storage tank 13 where, due to water quenching, it solidifies thereby giving rise to a vitrified and metallic non-leachable mineral granulate.

There are also a series of burners, vertically installed at outlet from the crucible launder trough, which means that the thermal energy generated is thereby able to smelt any eventual materials solidified as the result of the cooling of the same, caused by the ascending water vapour from the collection tank and the water-powered mineral and metallic granulate crushing device.

In order to avoid any synthesis gas flowing out from the gasification reactor towards the exterior through the launder trough of the melting crucible 9, the mineral and metallic granulate collection tank 13 is directly connected to it.

description.heading: • Quenching and purification of synthesis gas
description.p:
In this part of the system, as shown in figure 2, the synthesis gas is cooled and purified. All undesirable chemical substances and organic residue are removed by the synthesis gas, so to facilitate its recycling. The synthesis gas flowing out from the upper part of the high temperature reactor 8 undergoes the following stages:
quenching with water (16, 17)
acid washing (18)
basic washing (19, 20)
initial elimination of sulfidric acid (21)
elimination of fine particulate by means of wet electro-filter (22)
catalysis for the elimination of the organic compounds of Sulphur (27)
elimination of the residual sulfidric acid (28)
description.heading: ■ Quenching with water
description.p: The coarse synthesis gas leaves the reactor at a temperature between 800 and 1200 °C and more precisely at approx.1100°C and is cooled in the quench stage 16, by means of water, until it falls to a temperature of 90-95°C. This sudden cooling, serves to "freeze" the thermodynamic balance caused by the high-temperature reactor thereby avoiding the re-formation of dioxins and furans. The special characteristic of this rapid cooling process, as previously described, consists in the absence of technical appliances such as heat exchangers and other devices usually used for fluid cooling.
The thermal energy required for the cooling process proceeds from evaporation of the water used in the quench circuit.

The quantity of evaporated water is reintegrated by the last stage of process water treatment which, in turn, is almost totally destined for the treatment of condensate in the alkaline leaching stage.
description.heading: ■ Synthesis gas treatment
description.p: The gas cooled by evaporation in the quench stage 16 is submitted to acid scrubbing stage 18 in which a further treatment is undertaken. The presence of chloride and fluorine in the WSRF gives rise to the formation of HCl and HF in the high-temperature reactor. These components are dissolved in the aqueous quench stage giving rise to a highly acidic pH value.

Thanks to the treatment at pH <3, the volatile heavy metals contained in the coarse synthesis gas are dissolved in the form of chlorides and fluorides and are thereby eliminated from the synthesis gas. Further chemical substances that cause the formation of acids such as H2S, SO2, and CO2 continue to remain in a gaseous state and move on to the subsequent treatment stages. The quench water and the liquid used in acid scrubbing, operating in a closed loop, are de-gassed before being sent for a sedimentation and filtering process, which acts to separate the solid matter.
The purified washing liquid is sent to the quench through the pumps in the circuit, after cooling in a heat exchanger.

In the alkaline washing stage 20 the liquid droplets, from the previous acid treatment stage, conveyed by the synthesis gas flow, are then neutralized. For this purpose, the pH value of the washing fluid is maintained at a level of between 7-7.5 by the addition of NaOH. The excess of water, resulting from the condensation of the humidity present in the WSRF as well as from water evaporation, generated by the cooling process, which is flowing out from the quench stage, is sent to the chemical-physical system for process water treatment.

Through the breakdown of trivalent iron into bivalent iron and subsequent re-oxidation as the result of the input of air in the regeneration stage, the hydrogen sulphide is dissociated into elementary sulphur and hydrogen. The elimination of H2S occurs during the de-sulphuring treatment stage 21 during which the contact between the synthesis gas and the liquid solution is ensured by the capillary emission of liquid into the washer.

The oxidation of the bivalent iron and the subsequent regeneration of the de-sulphuring liquid, as well as the separation of the elementary sulphur, occur during the regeneration stage. After sedimentation, the sulphur is dehydrated in a filter-press and eliminated from the process.

After the de-sulphuring stage, the gas is treated in a wet electrostatic filter (EFU) 22 at the same temperature as the previous stage. The electro-physical process in this treatment stage permits the elimination of the volatile particulates and of the aerosols still present in the synthesis gas. The system also foresees the re-circulation in a semi-closed water circuit, thereby conveying part of the contaminated water to the oxidation stage and the re-integration of the clean water from the evaporation stage, and the crystallization of the process-water treating system.
description.heading: ■ Hydraulic guard and emergency flare
description.p: Both the high-temperature reactor and the synthesis gas treatment stages operate in a slight over-pressure condition (up to 450 bar), thereby avoiding the penetration of the oxygen present in the air and the resulting formation of explosive gas mixtures.

The main pipe 23 of the synthesis gas treatment section, as shown in figure 3, is connected to a Hydraulic guard 24 which acts as a safety valve. In the event of any sudden pressure increase over the security limits, the synthesis gas is conveyed through the hydraulic guard directly to the safety flare 25, which provides for its combustion. The emergency flare 25 is an important safety element as, in the event of any system faults, the gasification process cannot be suddenly interrupted and the gas must in any case be disposed of in a safe manner.
description.heading: ■ Process water treatment
description.p: The process water principally consists of water vapour condensed in the gas treatment stages, which partly comes from the humidity present in the WSRF, and partly resulting from the gasification and combustion processes.

The purification of the process water originating from the acid-basic treatment of the synthesis gas occurs in this unit. The condensate flow contains both metals and salts. The main phases of the chemical-physical process are:
Oxidation
Precipitation
Sedimentation
Neutralization
Evaporation and crystallisation

The treatment end-products are:
Concentrate of metal hydroxides and carbon residues
Mixed salt

The process water evaporated in the last treatment stage, after condensation, is used in the cooling circuit of the evaporation towers, thereby ensuring that the system is free of refluent fluids. The process water flowing out from the basic washing treatment stage is then sent to the oxidation tanks. It is oxidized through the addition of hydrogen peroxide so that the hydrogen sulphide dissolved in water is thereby transformed into dissolved sulphur, thus avoiding the escape of hydrogen sulphide gas in the subsequent treatment stages. At the same time, the bivalent iron is transformed into trivalent iron to improve the precipitation conditions. The agitators ensure an intense mixing action during the oxidation stage. After oxidation of the liquid from the basic washing treatment, the carbon sedimentation sludge and the clear water from the primary quenching circuit are conveyed to the storage tanks of the condensate produced during all the gas treatment stages during the cooling process. This storage area permits to normalize the liquid flow to the subsequent treatment stages.

The assumed pH value ranging from 8.5 to 9.0 is regulated by the addition of caustic soda so that the heavy metal hydroxides can be separated. The addition of CO2 through porous membranes permits the precipitation of the water dissolved calcium in the form of calcium carbonate. The sludge composed of carbon particles, calcium carbonate and metal hydroxides, is sent for the subsequent storage and dehydration stage, while in the clear aqueous stage it is pumped to the neutralization system. Hydrochloric acid is added so that the process water derived from the precipitation is neutralized before being sent to the subsequent ion exchanger. The neutralization stage permits the crystallization in the evaporation stage, in the form of salt, of both sodium chloride and ammonium chloride, which otherwise, due to the basic pH working values, would evaporate with the water.

Two alternatively operated cation exchangers convey the residues of calcium, zinc and other metals. Whilst one of the modules is operating, the other is regenerated. During the regeneration process, the metallic ions retained are replaced by sodium ions, which are in turn transferred to the water during the operating stage in order to withhold the metallic ions. The salts are crystallized in the evaporation system. The water vapour produced, after condensation, is sent to the cooling circuit to partially compensate for the reintegration water required for the operating of the evaporation towers. The crystalline aqueous solution is treated by a centrifugal machine to remove the salt crystals. This process does not generate any wastewater and is therefore free of any refluent fluid.

The water from the WSRF can only partially meet the needs of the evaporation cooling circuit, especially in the summer months. It is therefore necessary to connect up with the industrial mains for cooling purposes and to the drinking water mains for sanitary purposes. Alternatively, under certain territorial conditions, a liquid waste (i.e. sump percolation) treatment section might be integrated in the gasification system, contributed by third parties, in order to recycle the treated process water and make savings on the water resource.
description.heading: ■ Oxygen production system
description.p: The air fractionating system generates pure oxygen, nitrogen and compressed air. The oxygen is used in the thermal process, nitrogen for the rendering the various elements of the system inert, during the repair and maintenance operations, while the compressed air is used for the control of regulation and closing elements. In certain cases, the air fractionating system is not an integral part of the gasification system; the oxygen necessary for the gasification process being supplied through low-pressure piping from an external system positioned in the vicinity and intended for the production of engineering oxygen for various industrial uses.
description.heading: ■ Electric power production
description.p:
The purified synthesis gas may be conveyed to the following systems for the exploitation of its power potential:
gas turbines, after one or more compression stages; in combination with a cycle combined with a steam turbine for the production of solely electrical power, or through a co-generative cycle in the production of steam and/or hot water
gas motors in combination with a co-generating cycle for the production of electric power, steam and/or hot water
combustible cells with melted carbonates or running on solid oxides for the production of electric energy in combination with a re-generative cycle for the production of steam and/or hot water, or through heat pump, for cold energy.

The forced purification process of the synthesis gas, as provided by the present process, ensures, during its combustion for the production of thermal and electric energy, the compliance with the regulations relative to macro-pollutant atmospheric emissions, such as acid gases (HCl, HF), sulphur oxides and material in particulate form, while it excludes the presence of organic-chlorinated compounds such as dioxins and furans.

Thanks to the gasification system of the present invention which shows a reduced environmental impact, the WSRF can ideally be used in a system that ensures the benefits as repeatedly stated, providing a reliable response and an advanced technical solution as it ensures the maximum recovery of the resources contained in the waste, whilst at the same time limiting the environmental impact to a minimum, as it:
reduces the percentage of residues to be sent for final storage to a minimum rate of 20-25% by weight of the actual treated waste;
ensures maximum recovery and recycling of metals (iron, aluminium, metallic granulates) as well as of materials intended for the building sector (mineral granulate) and environmental recuperation
reduces environmental impact in terms of macro and micro air-polluting emissions
permits rational use of water resources
ensures that the processing residues are rendered completely inert and stabilized, ready to be sent for final storage.

claim.claim-text: Verfahren zur Wiederverwertung von Siedlungsmüll und zur Nutzung des aus dem Siedlungsmüll rückgewonnen Brennstoffs, wobei dieses Verfahren die folgenden Schritte umfasst: - die Entgegennahme des Siedlungsmülls, - die kontinuierliche und gleichförmige Einspeisung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs in einen Reaktor (8) mit mindestens einer Brennkammer, - die mechanische Sortierung der Trocken- und der Nassfraktion, - die Behandlung der Trockenfraktion und die Vorbehandlung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs, - die Rückgewinnung von Metallen, - die Behandlung der Nassfraktion, - die Raffination der stabilisierten organischen Fraktion, - die Volumenreduzierung von sperrigen Materialien, - die Behandlung der Verfahrensluft, - die Vergasung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs in einem Reaktor mit mindestens einer Brennkammer, - die Erzeugung von elektrischer Energie aus dem Gas, welches aus dem Verfahren abgeführt wird, und die Herstellung von Wasserstoff, wobei die Behandlung der Trockenfraktion und die Vorbehandlung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs die folgenden Schritte umfasst: - das Entfernen von metallischen Bestandteilen, - die Klassierung mit Hilfe einer Reißtrommel mit erweiterbarem Gitter, - die Windsichtung, - die Reinigung und die Verbesserung der Qualität, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass: a) die Vergasung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs die folgenden Schritte umfasst: - die Vergasung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs mittels Sauerstoff-Biogas-Brennern (11), - die Reinigung des erhaltenen Gases, - die durch Aufschmelzen erfolgende Umwandlung der in dem Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoff enthaltenen anorganischen Bestandteile in ein nicht auslaugfähiges mineralisches und metallisches Granulat, wobei das von den Brennern (11) benutzte Biogas aus dem Prozess der anaeroben Ausfaulung der organischen Fraktion stammt; b) die Behandlung der Nassfraktion eine aerobe Behandlung ist, welche aus einer biologischen Oxidation besteht, welche die folgenden Schritte umfasst: - die beschleunigte Zersetzung der organischen Substanzen innerhalb von 2 - 3 Wochen, - die Abtrennung der inerten Verarbeitungsrückstände von der Biomasse und - die Reifung und die Stabilisierung der organischen Fraktion innerhalb von 5 - 6 Wochen, wobei die genannte biologische Oxidation mit Hilfe von Zwangsbelüftung und mechanischem Umwenden auf aerobe Weise aufrecht erhalten wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Entgegennahme des Siedlungsmülls unter Verwendung einer Zuführungsstrecke mit mechanischer Sortiervorrichtung erfolgt, welche nach dem Wiegen jegliche sperrigen Materialien entfernt.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1 oder 2,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die mechanische Sortierung der Trocken- und der Nassfraktion durch die Siebroste von rotierenden Siebtrommeln mit Selbstreinigungsvorrichtung erfolgt, nachdem mit Hilfe von langsam rotierenden Beutelreißvorrichtungen die Öffnung für das Aussondern von Kunststoffbeuteln betätigt worden ist.

Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Rückgewinnung der Metalle durch elektromagnetische Wirkung und durch Wirbelströme erfolgt.

Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 5,
bei welchem außerdem - der Reaktor und die Gasbehandlungsstufen unter leichten Überdruckbedingungen arbeiten, wobei der Druck hoch bis 450 bar reicht, - die kohlenstoffhaltige Fraktion des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoff in einen Tiegel (9) im unteren Teil des Reaktors (8) fällt, wo die Temperatur zwischen 1500 und 1700°C , vorzugsweise bei 1600°C liegt, wobei die genannte kohlenstoffhaltige Fraktion nach Überführung in den flüchtigen Zustand vergast wird, - die Temperatur der aus dem Reaktor (8) austretenden Gase zwischen 800°C und 1200°C, vorzugsweise bei 1100°C liegt, - eine Reihe von Brennern im oberen Teil (10) des Reaktors (8), oberhalb des Zuführsystems für den Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoff, für eine leichte Turbulenz sorgt, welche die Homogenisierung der Temperatur optimiert, - der Tiegel (9) mit Hilfe von mit Biogas und Sauerstoff gespeisten Brennern (11) auf seiner Betriebstemperatur gehalten wird.

Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 6,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Gas, welches aus dem oberen Teil (10) des Reaktors (8) kommt, die folgenden Stufen durchläuft: - das Abschrecken mit Wasser (16, 17), - das Absäuern (18), - das Entalkalisieren (19, 20), - das anfängliches Entfernen von Schwefelwasserstoff (21), - die Eliminierung von Feinstoffteilchen mittels nasser elektrostatischer Filter (22), - die Katalyse zur Eliminierung von organischen Schwefelverbindungen (27), - die Eliminierung von restlichem Schwefelwasserstoff (28).

Verfahren nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 8,
bei welchem die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff die folgenden Schritte umfasst: - die CO-Reinigung durch zweistufige katalytische CO-Konvertierungsreaktion, - die Reinigung durch Trennung mittels semipermeabler Membranen und Druckwechseladsorption.

System zur Rückgewinnung von Siedlungsmüll und Nutzung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs, welches umfasst: - Mittel zur Entgegennahme des Siedlungsmülls, - eine oder mehrere Sortierlinien für das mechanische Sortieren der Trocken- und der Nassfraktion, - Mittel zur Behandlung der Trockenfraktion und Vorbehandlung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs, - Mittel zur elektromagnetischen Rückgewinnung von Metallen, - Mittel zur biologischen Oxidation der Nassfraktion, - eine mechanische Raffinationslinie zur Raffinierung des stabilisierten Biomülls, - Mahlmittel zur Volumenreduzierung von sperrigen Materialien, - ein System zur kontinuierlichen und gleichförmigen Zuführung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs, welches umfasst: - ein Vorratssilo für den Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoff, - ein Fördersystem (1) für den Transport des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs vom Vorratssilo zu einem Aufnahme- und Dosiergerät (2), - ein Fördersystem (3) für den Transport des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs vom Aufnahme-und Dosiergerät (2) zu einem Einlasssystem (5) in den Vergasungsreaktor (8), - einen Vergasungsreaktor (8) mit mindestens einer Brennkammer, - eine Abführleitung (15) vom Vergasungsreaktor (8), - einen Bereich für die Eliminierung von Feinteilchen (22) - ein System kombinierter Zyklen für die Erzeugung von Elektroenergie und ein System für die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das System umfasst: - einen Sammelbehälter für Granulat (13), - einen Bereich für die Wasserabschreckung (16, 17), - einen Bereich für die Absäuerung (18), - einen Bereich für die Entalkalisierung (19, 20), - einen Bereich für die anfängliche Eliminierung von Schwefelwasserstoff (21), - einen Katalysator für die Eliminierung von organischen Schwefelverbindungen (27), - einen Bereich für die Eliminierung von restlichem Schwefelwasserstoff (28),
wobei - der Reaktor (8) einen oberen Teil (10) und einen mit einem Schmelztiegel (9) ausgestatteten unteren Teil umfasst; - der genannte Granulatsammelbehälter (13) mit dem Tiegel (9) über einen Kanal (12) verbunden ist; - im oberen Teil (10) und im unteren Teil (9) des Reaktors (8) sowie im Kanal (12) Sauerstoff-Biogas-Brenner installiert sind, wobei das System für die kontinuierliche und gleichmäßige Zuführung von Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoff außerdem umfasst: - ein doppeltes Abdichtsystem (4) mit Ventilen, - ein mit Stickstoff arbeitendes Inertisierungssystem, - ein Fördersystem (5) zur Zuführung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs in den Vergasungsreaktor (8), - ein Rückgewinnungssystem (6) für überschüssige Kapazität, und wobei das System außerdem Mittel zur Gewinnung des Biogases aus dem anaeroben Faulungsvorgang und zur Zuführung dieses Gases zu den Brennern (11) umfasst.

System nach Anspruch 10,
bei welchem das Fördersystem (5) zur Zuführung des Müll-Rückgewinnungsbrennstoffs in den Vergasungsreaktor (8) ein gekühlter Schneckenförderer oder eine Schräge ist.

System nach einem der Ansprüche 10 oder 11,
bei welchem der Bereich für die Eliminierung der Feinteilchen (22) einen Nass-Elektrofilter umfasst.

System nach einem der Ansprüche 10 bis 12,
bei welchem zwischen dem Bereich für die Eliminierung von Feinteilchen (22) und dem Katalysator für die Eliminierung der organischen Schwefelverbindungen (27) eine mit einer Notfallfackel (25) direkt verbundene Wassersperre (24) vorhanden ist.

System nach einem der Ansprüche 10 bis 13,
bei welchem das System zur Produktion von Elektroenergie Gasturbinen und Motoren umfasst.

System nach einem der Ansprüche 10 bis 14,
bei welchem das System zur Produktion von Wasserstoff eine CO-Reinigungsanlage, eine Anlage zur Trennung mittels semipermeabler Membranen, eine Anlage zur Druckwechselabsorption, eine Anlag zur Verdichtung und Speicherung von Wasserstoff umfasst.

Method for the recycling of municipal solid waste, and use of the wasted solid recovered fuel, comprising the following steps: - receiving of the municipal solid waste, - feeding continuously and homogeneously the wasted solid recovered fuel into a reactor (8) with at least one combustion chamber, - mechanical sorting of dry and wet fractions, - treatment of the dry fraction and preparation of the wasted solid recovered fuel, - recovery of metals, - treatment of the wet fraction, - refining of stabilized organic fraction, - volume reduction of bulky materials, - process air treatment - gasification of the wasted solid recovered fuel in a reactor with at least one combustion chamber, - production of electric energy from the gas derived from the process and production of hydrogen, wherein
the treatment of the dry fraction and preparation of the wasted solid recovered fuel comprises the following steps: - removal of the metallic items - sizing by means of a shredder with extendable grating - wind sifting, - cleaning and quality enhancement; characterised in that: a. the gasification of the wasted solid recovered fuel comprises the steps of: - gasification of the wasted solid recovered fuel by means of oxygen-biogas-burners (11), - cleaning of the obtained gas, - conversion, by melting, of the inorganic components present in the wasted solid recovered fuel into vitrified non-leachable mineral and metallic granulate, wherein the biogas used by the burners (11) derives from the process of anaerobic digestion
of the organic fraction; b. the treatment of the wet fraction is an aerobic treatment consisting of a bio-oxidation comprising the steps of: - accelerated decomposition of the organic substances for 2-3 weeks, - separation of inert processing residues from the bio-mass and - maturation and stabilization of the organic fraction for 5-6 weeks, wherein said bio-oxidation is maintained aerobic by means of forced aeration and mechanical overturning.

Method according to claim 1,
characterised in that the receiving of the municipal solid waste is performed using a feeder line with mechanical sorting device, which, after weighing, removes any bulky materials.

Method according to claim 1 or 2,
characterised in that the mechanical sorting of the dry and wet fractions occurs through the screening grates of rotating trommels with self-cleaning device, after performing the plastic refuse bags-opening by means of slow-rotating bag-splitters.

Method according to one of the claims 1 to 3,
characterised in that the recovery of the metals occurs by electromagnetic and eddy currents actions.

Method according to one of claims 1 to 5,
wherein additionally - the reactor and the gas treatment stages operate in slight over-pressure condition wherein the pressure is up to 450 bar; - a carbonious fraction of the wasted solid recovered fuel falls into a crucible (9) in the lower part of the reactor (8), where the temperature is comprised between 1500 and 1700°C, preferably 1600°C, said carbonious fraction being gasified after the volatile fraction, - the temperature of the gasses exiting the reactor (8) is comprised between 800 and 1200°C, preferably 1100°C, - a series of burners in the upper part (10) of the reactor (8), above the wasted solid recovered fuel feeding system, impress a slight turbulence which optimises the temperature homogenisation, - the crucible (9) is maintained at working temperature by means of biogas and oxygen fed by burners (11).

Method according to one of the claims 1 to 6,
characterised in that the gas coming from the upper part (10) of the reactor (8) undergoes the following stages: - quenching with water (16, 17) - acid washing (18) - basic washing (19, 20) - initial elimination of sulfidric acid (21) - elimination of fine particulate by means of wet electrostatic filter (22) - catalysis for the elimination of organic compounds of Sulphur (27) - elimination of residual sulfidric acid (28)

Method according to one of the claims 1 to 8,
wherein the production of hydrogen comprises the steps: - CO clean-up by two stages water gas shift catalyst reaction, - purification by means of membranes separation and pressure swing adsorption

System for the recycling of municipal solid waste and exploitation of the wasted solid recovered fuel, comprising: - means for receiving the municipal solid waste - one or more sorting lines for the mechanical sorting of dry and wet fractions - means for the dry fraction treatment and preparation of the wasted solid recovered fuel - means for electro-magnetically recovering metals - means for the bio-oxidation of the wet fraction - mechanical refinement line for the refinement of the stabilized bio-waste - grinding means for the volume-reduction of bulky materials - a system for the continuous and homogeneous feeding of wasted solid recovered fuel, comprising : - a wasted solid recovered fuel storage silo - a conveyance system (1) of the wasted solid recovered fuel from the storage silo to a dosing receiver (2) - a conveyance system (3) of the wasted solid recovered fuel from the dosing receiver (2) to an inlet system (5) into a gasification reactor (8) - a gasification reactor (8) with at least one combustion chamber, - an outgoing conduct (15) of the gasification reactor (8), - - a section for the elimination of like particulate (22), - a system of combined cycles for the production of electric energy and a system for the production of hydrogen,
characterised in that the system comprises: - a granulate collection tank (13), - a section for the water quenching (16, 17), - a section for the acid washing (18), - a section for the basic washing (19, 20), - a section for the initial elimination of sulfidric acid (21), - a catalyst for the elimination of organic compounds of Sulphur (27), - a section for the elimination of residual sulfidric acid (28),
in that - the reactor (8) comprises an upper part (10) and a lower part provided with a melting crucible (9); - said granulate collection tank (13) is connected to the crucible (9) by means of a channel (12) - oxygen-biogas-bumers (11) are installed in the upper part (10) and in the lower part (9) of the reactor (8) as well as in the channel (12), wherein the system for the continuous and homogeneous feeding of wasted solid recovered fuel further comprises: - a double sealing system (4) with valves - an inertisation system with Nitrogen, - a conveyance system (5) for feeding the wasted solid recovered fuel into the gasification reactor (8) - an excessive capacity recovery system (6) and wherein the system further comprises means for recovering the biogas from the anaerobic digestion process and providing it to the burners (11).

A system according to claim 10,
wherein the conveyance system (5) for feeding the wasted solid recovered fuel into the gasification reactor (8) is a cooled screw feeder or a slope.

System according to one of the claims 10 or 11,
wherein the section for the elimination of fine particulate (22) comprises a wet electro-filter.

System according to one of the claims 10 to 12,
wherein a hydraulic guard (24) directly connected to an emergency flare (25) is provided between the section for the elimination of fine particulate (22) and the catalyst for the elimination of the organic compounds of Sulphur (27).

System according to one of the claims 10 to 13,
wherein the system for the production of electric energy comprises gas turbines and engines.

System according to one of the claims 10 to 14,
wherein the system for the production of hydrogen comprises a CO clean-up unit, membranes separation unit, pressure swing adsorption unit, hydrogen compression and storage unit.

Procédé pour le recyclage de déchets solides municipaux, et utilisation du combustible récupéré de déchets solides, comprenant les étapes suivantes : - la réception des déchets solides municipaux, - la distribution continue et homogène du combustible récupéré de déchets solides dans un réacteur (8) avec au moins une chambre de combustion, - le triage mécanique de fractions sèches et humides, - le traitement de la fraction sèche et la préparation du combustible récupéré de déchets solides, - la récupération de métaux, - le traitement de la fraction humide, - le raffinage d'une fraction organique stabilisée, - la réduction volumique de matières volumineuses, - le traitement d'air de procédé, - la gazéification du combustible récupéré de déchets solides dans un réacteur avec au moins une chambre de combustion, - la production d'énergie électrique à partir du gaz dérivé du procédé et la production d'hydrogène, dans lequel le traitement de la fraction sèche et la préparation du combustible récupéré de déchets solides comprend les étapes suivantes : - l'élimination des articles métalliques - le calibrage au moyen d'un déchiqueteur avec une grille extensible, - le tamisage à l'air, - le nettoyage et l'amélioration de la qualité ; caractérisé en ce que : a. la gazéification du combustible récupéré de déchets solides comprend les étapes de : - gazéification du combustible récupéré de déchets solides au moyen de brûleurs d'oxygène-biogaz (11), - nettoyage du gaz obtenu, - conversion, par fusion, des composants inorganiques présents dans le combustible récupéré de déchets solides en granulat minéral et métallique non lixiviable vitrifié, dans lequel le biogaz utilisé par les brûleurs (11) est dérivé du procédé de digestion anaérobie de la fraction organique ; b. le traitement de la fraction humide est un traitement aérobie constitué d'une bio-oxydation comprenant les étapes de : - décomposition accélérée des substances organiques pendant 2 à 3 semaines, - séparation de résidus de traitement inertes à partir de la biomasse, et - maturation et stabilisation de la fraction organique pendant 5 à 6 semaines, dans lequel ladite bio-oxydation est maintenue aérobie au moyen d'aération forcée et de reversement mécanique.

Procédé selon la revendication 1,
caractérisé en ce que la réception des déchets solides municipaux est réalisée en utilisant une conduite d'alimentation avec un dispositif de triage mécanique, qui, après un pesage, élimine toute matière volumineuse.

Procédé selon la revendication 1 ou 2,
caractérisé en ce que le triage mécanique des fractions sèches et humides se produit à travers les grilles de tamisage de tamis rotatifs avec un dispositif d'auto-nettoyage, après la réalisation de l'ouverture de sacs à ordures en plastique au moyen de trancheuses de sac à rotation lente.

Procédé selon une des revendications 1 à 3,
caractérisé en ce que la récupération des métaux se produit par actions de courants électromagnétiques et de Foucault.

Procédé selon une des revendications 1 à 5, dans lequel en outre - le réacteur et les étages de traitement de gaz fonctionnent dans une condition de légère surpression dans lequel la pression est jusqu'à 450 bars ; - une fraction de carbone du combustible récupéré de déchets solides tombe dans un creuset (9) dans la partie inférieure du réacteur (8), où la température est comprise entre 1500 et 1700°C, de préférence 1600°C, ladite fraction de carbone étant gazéifiée après la fraction volatile, - la température des gaz sortant du réacteur (8) est comprise entre 800 et 1200°C, de préférence 1100°C, - une série de brûleurs dans la partie supérieure (10) du réacteur (8), au-dessus du système de distribution de combustible récupéré de déchets solides, impose une légère turbulence qui optimise l'homogénéisation de température, - le creuset (9) est maintenu à température de fonctionnement au moyen de biogaz et d'oxygène distribué par les brûleurs (11).

Procédé selon une des revendications 1 à 6,
caractérisé en ce que le gaz provenant de la partie supérieure (10) du réacteur (8) subit les étapes suivantes : - le refroidissement avec de l'eau (16, 17) - le lavage acide (18) - le lavage basique (19, 20) - l'élimination initiale d'acide sulfhydrique (21) - l'élimination de particule fine au moyen d'un filtre électrostatique humide (22) - la catalyse pour l'élimination de composés organiques de soufre (27) - l'élimination d'acide sulfhydrique résiduel (28).

Procédé selon une des revendications 1 à 8,
dans lequel la production d'hydrogène comprend les étapes : - le nettoyage de CO par réaction de catalyseur à conversion de gaz à l'eau à deux étages, - l'épuration au moyen de séparation de membranes et d'adsorption modulée en pression.

Système pour le recyclage de déchets solides municipaux et l'exploitation du combustible récupéré de déchets solides, comprenant : - des moyens pour recevoir les déchets solides municipaux, - une ou plusieurs conduites de triage pour le triage mécanique de fractions sèches et humides, - des moyens pour le traitement de fraction sèche et la préparation du combustible récupéré de déchets solides, - des moyens pour la récupération électromagnétique de métaux, - des moyens pour la bio-oxydation de la fraction humide, - une conduite de raffinage mécanique pour le raffinage des bio-déchets stabilisés, - des moyens de broyage pour la réduction volumique de matières volumineuses - un système pour la distribution continue et homogène de combustible récupéré de déchets solides, comprenant : - un silo de stockage de combustible récupéré de déchets solides, - un système de transport (1) du combustible récupéré de déchets solides du silo de stockage à un récepteur doseur (2), - un système de transport (3) du combustible récupéré de déchets solides du récepteur doseur (2) à un système d'entrée (5) dans un réacteur de gazéification (8), - un réacteur de gazéification (8) avec au moins une chambre de combustion, - une conduit de sortie (15) du réacteur de gazéification (8), - une section pour l'élimination de particule fine (22), - un système de cycles combinés pour la production d'énergie électrique et un système pour la production d'hydrogène, caractérisé en ce que le système comprend : - un réservoir de collecte de granulat (13), - une section pour le refroidissement à l'eau (16, 17), - une section pour le lavage acide (18), - une section pour le lavage basique (19, 20), - une section pour l'élimination initiale d'acide sulfhydrique (21), - un catalyseur pour l'élimination de composés organiques de soufre (27), - une section pour l'élimination d'acide sulfhydrique résiduel (28),
en ce que - le réacteur (8) comprend une partie supérieure (10) et une partie inférieure pourvue d'un creuset de fusion (9) ; - ledit réservoir de collecte de granulat (13) est raccordé au creuset (9) au moyen d'un canal (12) ; - des brûleurs d'oxygène-biogaz (11) sont installés dans la partie supérieure (10) et dans la partie inférieure (9) du réacteur (8) ainsi que dans le canal (12), dans lequel le système pour la distribution continue et homogène de combustible récupéré de déchets solides comprend en outre : - un système d'étanchéité double (4) avec des soupapes, - un système d'inertage avec de l'azote, - un système de transport (5) pour distribuer le combustible récupéré de déchets solides dans le réacteur de gazéification (8), - un système de récupération de capacité excessive (6), et dans lequel le système comprend en outre des moyens pour récupérer le biogaz à partir du procédé de digestion anaérobie et le fournir aux brûleurs (11).

Système selon la revendication 10,
dans lequel le système de transport (5) pour distribuer le combustible récupéré de déchets solides dans le réacteur de gazéification (8) est un dispositif d'alimentation à vis refroidi ou une pente.

Système selon une des revendications 10 ou 1 l,
dans lequel la section pour l'élimination de particule fine (22) comprend un électro-filtre humide.

Système selon une des revendications 10 à 12,
dans lequel un élément de protection hydraulique (24) raccordé directement à une torche d'urgence (25) est prévu entre la section pour l'élimination de particule fine (22) et le catalyseur pour l'élimination des composés organiques de soufre (27).

Système selon une des revendications 10 à 13,
dans lequel le système pour la production d'énergie électrique comprend des turbines à gaz et des moteurs.

Système selon une des revendications 10 à 14,
dans lequel le système pour la production d'hydrogène comprend une unité de nettoyage de CO, une unité de séparation de membranes, une unité d'adsorption modulée en pression, une unité de compression et de stockage d'hydrogène.
